info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued August 13 at 1:35PM EDT until August 13 at 4:45PM EDT by NWS State College PA
info.description:
FFWCTP
The National Weather Service in State College has issued a
* Flash Flood Warning for... Southwestern Huntingdon County in central Pennsylvania... Northeastern Bedford County in south central Pennsylvania... Northeastern Fulton County in south central Pennsylvania...
* Until 445 PM EDT.
* At 135 PM EDT, Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the warned area. Between 1 and 2.5 inches of rain have fallen. Additional rainfall amounts of 0.5 to 1.5 inches are possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly.
HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms.
SOURCE...Radar and automated gauges.
IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas.
* Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... New Enterprise, Osterburg, Waterfall, Rockhill Furnace, Wells Tannery, Dudley, Coaldale, St. Clairsville, Cessna, Saxton, Broad Top City, Three Springs, Orbisonia, Saltillo, Defiance, Hopewell, Coalmont and Shade Gap.
info.instruction:
Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely.
